articles.title: Sit-in Strike Declared in S. Korea
Information Bulletin Published in Austria
articles.content:
Sit-in Strike Declared in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly declared an anti-U.S., anti-war sit-in strike for peace in protest against the south Korean authorities' decision to additionally dispatch troops to Iraq in Seoul on Oct. 20.
 At a ceremony, the organization charged that the U.S. demand for additional troop dispatch to Iraq aimed at imposing its military and political burden upon others would only coil up crisis of war on the Korean peninsula.    
 The organization said that in the period of the sit-in strike it would hold a photo exhibition, distribute printed materials, conduct a signature campaign, stage art performance, etc. and have a meeting on November 1.
